tossup_question: -   –  When doing mass spectrometry, one will notice that atoms of the same element will have slightly different charge-to-mass ratios. Which of the following particles is responsible for this difference?
tossup_MCQoptions:
W) Proton
X) Electron
Y) Neutron
Z) Meson
bonus_question: -   –  In Rutherford’s nuclear model of the atom, he could not understand why the positive charges in a dense nucleus would not repel each other. Which force was later found to be holding the nucleus together?
bonus_answer: ANSWER: STRONG FORCE (ACCEPT: STRONG NUCLEAR FORCE)
